
#Main Regressions
```{r}
#Basic regression - treats variables as continuous with no controls
feols(G3~Dalc+Walc,MathData)
feols(G3~Dalc+Walc,PortugueseData)
#We see coefficients we'd expect, but high p values in MathData
```



```{r}
#Now adding controls in
feols(G3~Dalc+Walc+age+goout+romantic+famrel,MathData)
feols(G3~Dalc+Walc+age+goout+romantic+famrel,PortugueseData)
#Changes are all over the place, but mostly we see a smaller coefficient on alcohol. Walc does become positive in Math. P values are up and down.
```


```{r}
#Regressions with factor. Trying to show how messy it is, give Jesse a sense of how we progressed to doing the binary regression
feols(G3 ~ factor(Dalc) + factor(Walc) + goout + romantic + age + famrel, data = MathData)
feols(G3 ~ factor(Dalc) + factor(Walc) + goout + romantic + age + famrel, data = PortugueseData)
```



```{r}
#Binary, no controls
feols(G3 ~ highDalc + highWalc, data = MathData)
feols(G3 ~ highDalc + highWalc, data = PortugueseData)
```


```{r}
#Using the binary variables highWalc and highDalc. OUR MAIN REGRESSION/FINAL MODEL
feols(G3 ~ highDalc + highWalc + goout + romantic + age + famrel, data = MathData)
feols(G3 ~ highDalc + highWalc + goout + romantic + age + famrel, data = PortugueseData)
```

```{r}
#Interacting romantic and sex
feols(G3 ~ highDalc + highWalc + goout + romantic:sex + age + famrel, data = MathData)
feols(G3 ~ highDalc + highWalc + goout + romantic:sex + age + famrel, data = PortugueseData)
```



```{r}
#Attempting to square alcohol variables. More for fun than anything - the p values are terrible - to see if we can find optimal alcohol consumption
feols(G3~Dalc+I(Dalc^2)+Walc+I(Walc^2)+age+goout+romantic,MathData)
feols(G3~Dalc+I(Dalc^2)+Walc+I(Walc^2)+age+goout+romantic,PortugueseData) 
```
